solution_line_template: It will take {num_cats} * {minutes_per_cat} = <<{num_cats}*{minutes_per_cat}={time_brushing_cats}>>{time_brushing_cats} minutes to brush his cats.

All together, it will take {time_vacuum} + {time_dust} + {time_mop} + {time_brushing_cats} = <<{time_vacuum}+{time_dust}+{time_mop}+{time_brushing_cats}={total_cleaning_time}>>{total_cleaning_time} minutes to clean his apartment.
In three hours, there are {minutes_per_hour} * {free_time_hours} = <<{minutes_per_hour}*{free_time_hours}={total_free_time_minutes}>>{total_free_time_minutes} minutes.
Thus, he will have {total_free_time_minutes} - {total_cleaning_time} = <<{total_free_time_minutes}-{total_cleaning_time}={remaining_free_time}>>{remaining_free_time} minutes of free time remaining.
